info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 9:38AM CDT until May 30 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Morris, Franklin and Titus Counties.
For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White Oak Creek near Talco.
* WHEN...From Wednesday evening to Friday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday evening to a crest of 16.5 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 945 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Franklin, TX; Morris, TX; Titus, TX
